channel.title: RFC: What makes a tutorial a tutorial?
channel.description:
Hi 0x00'ers!
Discussion on the IRC has posited this: _There are tutorials, and then there are cheatsheets._
__Cheatsheets__ provide basic information, a simple, short how-to.
__Tutorials__ are significantly more in-depth, and they provide the _why_'s of a topic.
0x00sec is lucky enough to have _both_ on this site. What we do want to know, however, is how to handle _cheatsheets_, since they aren't really _tutorials_.
### Should we do something about this? [poll] - We should separate them. - We have cheatsheets? - Keep it as is. [/poll]
The above poll is preliminary, and the site Leaders would greatly appreciate any comments/discussion below.
EDIT: The above assumes that __both__ tutorials and cheatsheets are accurate with respect to their content.

item.title: RFC: What makes a tutorial a tutorial?
item.dc:creator: oaktree
item.description:
That’s a good idea! The reference category might just be the place for them!

Read full topic
item.source: RFC: What makes a tutorial a tutorial?

item.title: RFC: What makes a tutorial a tutorial?
item.dc:creator: pry0cc
item.description:
This is my take. We should separate them; put them in the references subcategory. Since they are references.

Read full topic
